e4: Changing to the new policy promotes truthfulness and aligns with ethical practices by ensuring reported earnings reflect actual performance without artificial inflation. This transparency fosters long-term trust with investors, potentially broadens the investor base, and reduces legal risks associated with misrepresentation, despite the initial adjustment period in investor perception.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should emphasize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring financial reports reflect true company performance without manipulation or bias. It should prioritize investor trust, allowing informed decision-making, and adhere to legal standards to avoid misleading stakeholders. Regular audits and clear communication of any significant changes in reporting practices are also essential.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to communicate the transition to the new policy to ensure investors understand the change, both strategically and operationally, and what steps will be taken to minimize potential negative market reactions.
